revision.text: ==Classical Nahuatl== ===Etymology=== From {{compound|nci|xihuitl|tōtōtl|t1=turquoise|t2=bird}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|nci|/ʃiwtoːtoːtɬ/}} * {{IPA|nci|[ʃiʍˈtóːtoːt͡ɬ]}} ===Noun=== {{head|nci|noun|head=xiuhtōtōtl}} # a [[lovely cotinga]] #* '''16th century''', [[w:Bernardino de Sahagún|Bernardino de Sahagún]], "[[w:Florentine Codex|Florentine Codex]]", book 11, chapter 2, paragraph 1: #*: '''Xiuhtototl''': [...] iuhquj, ixqujch in tzanatl. tenvitztic, tentliltic: in jielpan aiopaltic #*: (Lovely cotinga: [...] It is like all the slender-billed grackles. The bill is pointed, black. Its breast is purple, [etc.]) #* '''17th century''', [[w:Pedro Calderón de la Barca|Pedro Calderón de la Barca]] (Spanish), [[w:Bartolomé de Alva|Bartolomé de Alva]] (Nahuatl translation), ''El Gran Teatro del Mundo'', f. 2r.: #*: Motech patlantinemi yn '''Xiuhtototl''', yn tzinytzcan, yn tlauhquechol yn Zaquan. #*: (The blue cotinga, the trogon, the roseate spoonbill, and the troupial fly around on you [''sc.'' the earth].) # a [[lovely cotinga]] [[feather]] #* '''16th century''', [[w:Bernardino de Sahagún|Bernardino de Sahagún]], "[[w:Florentine Codex|Florentine Codex]]", book 1, chapter 19: #*: in nepapan ihujtl, in quetzalli, in tzinjtzcan, in tlauhquechol, '''xiuhtototl''', in toztli, çaqua: quauhtli #*: (all manner of feathers: the long tail feathers of the resplendent trogon, its red breast feathers, those of the roseate spoonbill, the lovely cotinga, the yellow headed parrot the troupial, the eagle) #* {{circa2|'''1609'''}} [[w:Fernando Alvarado Tezozomoc|Tezozomoc]], [[w:Chimalpahin|Chimalpahin]], ''[[w:Crónica mexicayotl|Crónica mexicayotl]]'', f. 24r: #*: auh yn nepapan yhuitl yhuan amechmacazq̃. yn '''xiuhtototl''' yn tlauhquechol yn tzinitzca. #*: (And they will also give you the various kinds of feathers—cotinga, spoonbill, trogon) ====Derived terms==== * {{l|nci|xiuhtotonacochtli}} * {{l|nci|xiuhtototic}} ===References=== * {{cite-book|author=Andrews, J.
